all_text_timv: Auerbach, Berthold, 1812-1882. Berthold Auerbach letter. Berlin, 1874 January 6. 1 leaf. text txt rdacontent unmediated n rdamedia sheet nb rdacarrier In Rare Books and Manuscripts, University Libraries, Pennsylvania State University, Univerrsity Park, Pa. (#RBM/A-S VF) Unrestricted access. Berthold Auerbach writes this letter from Berlin, 6 January 1874, in which he mentions Sulzberger. Berthold Auerbach (28 February 1812 - 8 February 1882) was a German-Jewish poet and author. He was the founder of the German "tendency novel," in which fiction is used as a means of influencing public opinion on social, political, moral, and religious questions. Auerbach, Berthold, 1812-1882 Archives. Letters (correspondence) aat Allison-Shelley manuscript collection Gift of Phillip Allison Shelley.
general_note_ssm: In Rare Books and Manuscripts, University Libraries, Pennsylvania State University, Univerrsity Park, Pa. (#RBM/A-S VF)
notes_summary_ssim: Berthold Auerbach writes this letter from Berlin, 6 January 1874, in which he mentions Sulzberger.
administrative_history_note_ssm: Berthold Auerbach (28 February 1812 - 8 February 1882) was a German-Jewish poet and author. He was the founder of the German "tendency novel," in which fiction is used as a means of influencing public opinion on social, political, moral, and religious questions.
location_facet: Rare Books & Manuscripts, 1st Floor Paterno, Allison-Shelley Collection
